articles.description: Aaron Ramsdale is eventually left smiling after Arsenal spare the England goalkeeper's blushes and beat Brentford to move top of the Premier League.
articles.title: Ramsdale relief after blunder as Arsenal go top

articles.description: Max Verstappen cruised to the latest in a long line of victories at the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix but Red Bull are still embroiled in controversy, writes Andrew Benson.
articles.title: 'Max Verstappen victorious again but Red Bull power struggle continues and questions remain'

articles.description: Marcus Smith follows in the footsteps of Jonny Wilkinson and George Ford in English drop-goal folklore, but he will have his eyes on a more sustained run in the side.
articles.title: Match-winner Smith returns to stake England claim

articles.description: A propensity to implode, as they did in Rome, will continue to hold back Gregor Townsend's Scotland, writes Tom English.
articles.title: 'Yo-yo life continues for despondent Scots in Rome'

articles.description: Harry Kane becomes the first man to score four hat-tricks in their debut Bundesliga season as Bayern Munich maintain pressure on Bayer Leverkusen.
articles.title: Kane sets hat-trick record as Bayern win 8-1

articles.description: Briton Emma Raducanu reaches round three at Indian Wells after opponent Dayana Yastremska retires with an injury in the opening set.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Emma Raducanu into round three as Dayana Yastremska retires

articles.description: Saturday's 2-0 win over Everton is one that will stabilise Manchester United's season, writes BBC Sport's Simon Stone.
articles.title: 'Win stabilises Man Utd season but Ten Hag future still unclear'

articles.description: It is hard not to draw comparisons with Ireland's World Cup exit after they were edged out by England in an epic Six Nations match at Twickenham, writes Matt Gault.
articles.title: 'Shades of Paris as Ireland's Slam hopes end in epic'

articles.description: Luka Doncic becomes the first NBA player to record six consecutive 30-point triple-doubles as the Dallas Mavericks win 142-124 at the Detroit Pistons.
articles.title: NBA: Luka Doncic sets new record in Dallas Mavericks win at Detroit Pistons

articles.description: Inter Milan move 18 points clear at the top of the Serie A table with a narrow win at Champions League-chasing Bologna.
articles.title: Inter Milan edge Bologna to move 18 points clear
